snippet: The 101st Precinct in Far Rockaway, a low-income neighborhood wary of the police, has seen halting progress as the department seeks to reshape everyday interactions between officers and residents.
abstract: Far Rockaway's 101st Precinct tests model of community policing that gives officers opportunity to interact with members of neighborhood throughout their shift and not just respond to crime; city plans to expand pilot program, which has national endorsement, to more than dozen other areas, in hopes of solving potential problems and reducing crime.
lead_paragraph: The 101st Precinct in Far Rockaway, a low-income neighborhood wary of the police, has seen halting progress as the department seeks to reshape everyday interactions between officers and residents.

headline.main: In New York, Testing Grounds for Community Policing
headline.print_headline: Back on the Beat in Far Rockaway
